text:
Showing my age here, but I have been using every iteration of Ivanti Security
Controls since it was HFNetChk. I does what I need to do without any issues. 
Also, keep in mind that many patch management vendors use Ivanti on the backend
via different types of partner collaborations such as full-service partners and
embedded or integrated solutions. 
Thanks, 
Luis Elizondo | Cybersecurity Operations Architect / Security Lead | x4549 
“The difference between successful people and really successful people is that
really successful people say no to almost everything.” – Warren Buffet

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what?
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from lelizondo@imrf.org. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Showing my age here, but I have been using every iteration of Ivanti Security
Controls since it was HFNetChk. I does what I need to do without any issues. 
Also, keep in mind that many patch management vendors use Ivanti on the backend
via different types of partner collaborations such as full-service partners and

Thanks,

From: 'Dave Lum' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 8, 2024 6:40 AM
To: 'patchmanagement@googlegroups.com' <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
ATTENTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. This email is
from an external source. Use caution before opening attachments or clicking on
links. 
The Ivanti console hasn’t changed all that much since back when it was Shavlik
or LANDesk, I’ve used this product across three different employers and 15-ish
years now… 
Dave 
From: 'McLennan, Jason' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 8, 2024 2:36 AM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
We’re looking into this now. Tanium wasn’t even on our list to evaluate so I’ll
add it 😊 
Didn’t really get on with Ivanti, the console just looked old and tired, and
they seem to have just bolted on some basic Linux stuff just so they could say
‘you can manage Linux as well’. 
We’ve had a few demos with ManageEngine Endpoint Central and that looks pretty
good, nice web GUI and some neat features. We’re trialling how it works across
multiple segregated domains at the moment and will probably go with that if it
works due to cost vs functionality. 
We only need it for servers, not clients. 
Classification: BUSINESS
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/BY5PR09MB5763D4D1EE99511EF6684CFDC2442%40BY5PR09MB5763.namprd09.prod.outlook.com
